sources.title: House Of Cards (1968) George Peppard · Inger Stevens
sources.description: An American in Paris becomes involved in the coup plots of an old French family that has lost its large landholdings in Algeria. He exposes the right-wing extremist enterprise.   A superficial thriller with a pseudo-political background and a family-friendly happy ending.

metadata.Plot: Leschenhaut and Morillon are trying to organize a plot to overthrow the French government and set up a new fascist organization. Their plans are interrupted by Davis, an American boxer, tutor of young Paul de Villemont; in Villemont Manor he discovers the plot and, after the kidnapping of the boy, he travels to Rome, where the organization would exchange Paul with a list of members stolen by Davis to give to the press.
metadata.Writer: Irving Ravetch, Harriet Frank Jr., Stanley Ellin
metadata.Actors: George Peppard, Inger Stevens, Orson Welles
